definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Job 5:6 trouble, sorrow, wickedness—abs. Nu 23:21 +; sf. [[אוֹנִי]] Ge 35:18 etc.;  pl. [[אוֹנִים]] Ho 9:4—

trouble, sorrow [[בֶּן־אוֹנִי]] son of my trouble or sorrow Ge 35:18 (E); [[לֽא הִבִּיט אָוֶן בְּיַעֲקׂב]] Nu 23:21 (song of Balaam), he doth not behold trouble in Jacob (‖ he doth not see misery—[[עָמָל]]—in Isr); oft. ‖[[עָמָל]] Ps 7:15 ([[הִנֵּה יְחַבֶּל־אָוֶן]] lo he travaileth with trouble ‖[[וְהָרָה עָמָל וְיׇלַד שָָׁקֶר]], yea he hath conceived misery & brought forth a lie), prob. thence Job 15:35 ([[הָרהׁ עָמָל וְיׇלֽד אָוֶן]]) = Is 59:4; cf. [[עָמָל וׇאָוֶן]] Ps 10:7, Ps 55:11, Ps 90:10, Job 4:8, Job 5:6, Is 10:1 (v. [[עָמָל]]); also [[זוֹרֵעַ עַוְלָה יִקְחָר־אָוֶן]] Pr 22:8 the sower of iniquity shall reap trouble; in this sense elsewh. only De 26:14, Pr 12:21; Je 4:15; Hb Hab 3:7; Am 5:5, pl. intens. [[לֶחֶם אוֹנִים]] bread of trouble, sorrow, or mourning Ho 9:4.

idolatry Ho 12:12; Is 41:29; [[אָוֶן וּתְרָפִים הַפְחַָר]] stubbornness is idolatry & (the use of) teraphim 1Sa 15:23 (poet. source); [[אָוֶן בֵּית]] Ho 4:15 (for [[בֵּית אֵל]]because Bethel, house of God, is given over to idolatry) so also Ho 5:8; Ho 10:5 cf. ´[[בָּמוֹת א]] Ho 10:8; ´[[בִּקְעַת א]] Am 1:5 (Baalbek); ´[[בַּחוּרֵי א]] rd. [[אוֹן]], [[אׂן]] = On, Heliopolis Ez Eze 30:17; —abstr. for concr. = idols Is 66:3.

trouble of iniquity, wickedness, [[מְתֵי אָוֶן]] Job 22:15; ´[[אַנְשֵׁי א]] Job 34:36 = men of trouble, troublers, wicked men; cf. ´[[אִישׁ א]] Pr 6:12; Is 55:17; [[פּׂעֲלֵי אָוֶן]] workers of trouble, evil-doers, workers of iniquity Job 31:3, Job 34:8, Job 34:22, Ps 5:6; + (16 t. chiefly late Psalm) Pr 10:29, Pr 21:15, Is 31:2, Ho 6:8; [[מַחְשְׁבוֹת אָוֶן]] thoughts of trouble, wicked imaginations Pr 6:18, Is 59:7, Je 4:14; oft. of words & thoughts Job 11:11 + (5 t.) Ps 36:5 + (9 t.) Pr 17:4, Pr 19:28, Pr 30:20, Is 29:20, Is 32:6, Is 58:9, Is 59:6, Ez Eze 11:2, Mic 2:1, Hb Hab 1:3, Zec 10:2; [[לֽא]] [[אוּכַל אָוֶן וַעֲחָרָה]] Is 1:13 I cannot bear iniquity with the solemn meeting (RV & most mod.; AV it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting).
